caption:
b'Walk through a forest of light at the @usnwc. Inspired by nature, artist @meredith.connelly created a whimsical holiday light experience. Now, for the second year, you can see her sketches come to life in illuminated displays on a half-mile trail through the immersive art experience, Lights. Connelly and her team crafted more than 400 pieces of art depicting forest features from ground-dwelling mushrooms to canopy-level cocoons. Click the link in our bio for more.
.
.
.
#usnwc #immersiveart #nature #lightart'

b'When Suzy Macke shows up, it\xe2\x80\x99s because there\xe2\x80\x99s a problem. Being able to fix it, is the best part of her job. Macke is a lineworker in Cincinnati. She\xe2\x80\x99s a troubleman, which means she rides solo and is the first responder for most calls from customers. If she can fix it, power is restored faster because the customer won\xe2\x80\x99t have to wait for a larger crew to be dispatched and make repairs. Click the link in our bio to read more.
.
.
.
#thankalineman #lineworker #linelife #lineman #thankalineworker'

b"Our mission since bringing electricity to the Carolinas in 1904 has been to power the lives of our customers and the vitality of its communities. By 2050, we plan to achieve net-zero carbon emissions. It\xe2\x80\x99s ambitious, but we're well on our way. Click the link in our bio to learn more.
.
.
.
#esg #innovation #renewable #renewableenergy #futureofenergy #energystorage #hydro #ev"

b'Marshall Hydroelectric Station is the perfect backdrop for fall. Nestled on the French Broad River in North Carolina, the station began operations in 1910. Quick start-up times make hydroelectric power ideal for providing electricity in a matter of seconds when demand is high. :maple_leaf:
.
.
.
#hydropower #renewableenergy #hydroelectricity #frenchbroadriver #hydro #fall'

b'From the littlest electrical switches to rotors that weigh 300 tons, we recently completed a multi-year renovation at Cowans Ford Hydroelectric Station to update nearly every part of the plant. Cowans Ford, built in 1963, is the company\xe2\x80\x99s largest conventional hydroelectric plant. Located on Lake Norman, north of Charlotte, N.C., it can produce more than 320 megawatts of renewable, carbon-free energy in minutes \xe2\x80\x93 which means it can provide power quickly when demand peaks on hot summer afternoons and cold winter mornings. Click the link in our bio for more.
.
.
.
#cleanenergy #renewables #hydro #renewableenergy #hydroelectric #waterpower'

b'With a souped-up fish finder and an airboat, Brett and Eryn spend the summer on the Catawba and Wateree rivers looking for plants that could cause problems. They\xe2\x80\x99re scientists for our aquatic plant management program, and the sooner they find plants that could crowd waterways, the better it is for those who depend on the water. Click the link in our bio to learn more.
.
.
.
#aquaticplants #behindthescience #airboat #invasivespecies'

b'Join aquatic plant scientists Brett and Eryn as they take over our Instagram account to hunt for invasive plant species. Stay tuned for a behind-the-scenes look at how they protect our waterways.
.
.
.
#aquaticplants #behindthescience #airboat #invasivespecies'

b'We\xe2\x80\x99re celebrating #AmericanWindWeek by showcasing some of our teammates and their amazing views from across the country. For over a decade, we\xe2\x80\x99ve proudly provided wind energy solutions to businesses, developers and small utilities.
.
.
.
#windenergy #windtech #windturbine #renewableenergy #renewables'

b'Behind the orange groves that line U.S. Highway 27 in Frostproof, Fla., a Nucor Steel construction crew is building a first-of-its-kind steel mill for the state. To get transmission lines to the plant, we used helicopters, which was faster and reduced disruptions caused by construction. To build the line, crews still set the bases of the poles like normal, but they were able to skip the time-consuming task of pulling the line from pole to pole. The helicopter pilot attaches a lightweight rope to the aircraft and pulls it from a large spool to each pole where the rope is snapped into a roller attached to the pole. The 2 1/2-mile section of line took one day to complete with helicopters rather than the days or weeks it could have taken a crew. Click the link in our bio to learn more.
.
.
.
@nucorcorporation #helicopter #innovation #thankalineman #linelife #transmission #aviation #lineworker #nucor #nucorproud'

b'The issues facing bats are complex, but these critters are crucial to the ecosystem. Bats are small, they migrate and fly at night, so it\xe2\x80\x99s difficult to learn how many are out there. Some species are struggling with the deadly White Nose Syndrome, while many others face habitat loss, pesticides and the challenges associated with climate change. Wind energy is an additional hurdle. That\xe2\x80\x99s why we\xe2\x80\x99re using new technology to help keep these pollinators safe. The Bat Deterrent System, an ultrasonic acoustic device developed by NRG Systems, reduced overall bat fatalities by 50 percent with reductions of nearly 80 percent in some species. A study published in May found the technology so successful, that we\xe2\x80\x99ve equipped 255 wind turbines at Los Vientos with the device. It will be the first commercial-scale installation in the continental United States. Click the link in our bio to learn more.
.
.
.
#pollinators #renewableenergy #bat #newtech #windturbine #windpower'

b'Last week @northcarolinaports made history, welcoming the largest ship to ever enter the Port of Wilmington. We\xe2\x80\x99re proud to be part of this collaborative effort with local leaders and our crews who raised the transmission line over the Cape Fear River. See what it took to de-energize, climb and raise the lines as massive cranes made their way to the port.
.
.
.
#thankalineman #linelife #ncports #PortofWilmington #containershipping #ports #maritime #containership #lineworker'

b'What does a high school student do when his bull riding career runs out? Become a lineworker. At 19, after a childhood spent in rodeos, Josh Watson decided to follow in the footsteps of his father and grandfather who each served more than 30 years as lineworkers. Watson is based in Kernersville, N.C., just east of Winston-Salem, where his crew works on everything from overhead to underground lines. Earlier this year we followed Josh Watson to see what a typical day for a lineworker might be. Every day is different\xe2\x80\x93 and that\xe2\x80\x99s one of the things he loves about the job. Click the link in our bio to learn more.
.
.
.
#thankalineman #linelife #thankalineworker #lineman #lineworker'

b'Since 2013 we\xe2\x80\x99ve celebrated National Lineman Appreciation Day on April 18 to thank lineworkers for their tireless hard work and commitment to our customers. A lot has changed this year, but one thing that hasn\xe2\x80\x99t is their dedication to keeping the lights on for our customers. Join us this Saturday to help thank our lineworkers and other front line responders by turning on your front lights at 9 p.m. #thankalineman
.
.
.
#thankalineman #nationallinemanappreciationday #nlad #lineworker #linework #lineman #linemen #linemanappreciationday  #nationallineworkerappreciationday #thankalineworker #wearede'

b'Meet Chipo Mkandla. When she moved to the United States from Zimbabwe to work in hospitality, she never imagined she\xe2\x80\x99d end up at an energy company. It turns out the roles had more in common than she thought. Mkandla is part of Duke Energy\xe2\x80\x99s customer experience team, and her job is to study the interactions between customers and the company and see if she can find ways to improve them. For her, the most rewarding part is the company can measure the improvement in the customers\xe2\x80\x99 experiences. \xe2\x80\x9cWith technology and new innovations, customers are expecting more from us. We\xe2\x80\x99re looking at what technology we can use, what software is out there and how we can get ahead of it so we can be sure we\xe2\x80\x99re providing services that are valuable for our customers,\xe2\x80\x9d said Mkandla.
.
.
.
#WomensHistoryMonth #femaleleadership #data #technology #weareDE #womeninenergy'

b"Women make up about 20 percent of the country\xe2\x80\x99s utility industry workforce, and we're on a mission to change that. We\xe2\x80\x99ve powered the lives of our customers for more than a century. From charging your cell phone to running a business, electricity is at the foundation of everything we do. Our purpose hasn\xe2\x80\x99t changed, but as the industry evolves and we find new ways to generate cleaner energy and provide the products and services that customers ask for, we\xe2\x80\x99ll be stronger if our workforce reflects the communities we serve. For #WomensHistoryMonth, meet a few employees who want other women to know that they can find fulfilling careers in the energy industry from engineering to customer service, maintenance and more. These women excel in their roles while encouraging the next generation.
.
.
.
#WHM #engineer #nuclear #tech #womeninenergy #STEM #STEMgirls #technology"

b"We've installed our one millionth solar panel in Florida this month while putting the finishing touches on the Columbia Solar Power Plant. The site, in Fort White, Fla. about 45 minutes north of Gainesville, is the latest in the our effort to bring 700 megawatts of solar to the state by 2022 and 1,500 megawatts by 2028. By mid-2020, enough solar will have been installed in Florida to eliminate 1.5 billion pounds of carbon dioxide emissions annually.
.
.
.
#solar #renewableenergy #solarpanel #renewable #energy"

b'From a six-year-old with a science kit to #smartgrid engineer, Aleksandar Vukojevic is building the blueprint for the grid of the future. His passion for experimentation and education has earned him more than a dozen patents, two bachelor\xe2\x80\x99s degrees, a master\xe2\x80\x99s degree in electrical engineering from @GeorgiaTech, and an MBA from @GeorgiaStateUniversity. Why so many degrees? The same reason he became interested in engineering: his father, who instilled in him the value of education.\n\nThere are many kinds of #engineers \xe2\x80\x93 mechanical, civil, electrical, nuclear, chemical \xe2\x80\x93 but all of them have one thing in common: they love to solve problems and find ways to make things better. You can find just about any kind of engineer at Duke Energy working in the field, a power plant or the corporate office. To learn more about our engineers and celebrate #EWeek2020, click the link in our bio.'

b'After years of hiking deep into the @GreatSmokyNPS to service a park ranger communications tower, one lineman decided to shake things up. Technology is advancing, so why not bring some of that innovation into the woods? His idea, remove the power lines that serve the tower, and replace them with a #microgrid. This idea became a reality and we were able to return 13 acres of land back to the park.
.
.
.
#solar #renewableenergy #nationalpark #greatsmokymountains #thankalineman'

b'Meet Tim Hayes. He spends a lot of time looking at the ground. That might seem like an odd approach to interpret the world, but it\xe2\x80\x99s the way of a wildlife biologist.  Eyes pointed just beyond his feet, he looks for tufts of fur, tracks in the sand, and even bits of poop because these are clues as to what wildlife lives near Duke Energy Renewables\xe2\x80\x99 solar and wind sites. Every detail, he said, is a piece of the puzzle that provides a picture of the ecosystem and its health. \xe2\x80\x9cFor my whole career, I have been able to leverage the power of industry to be able to do good things for conservation,\xe2\x80\x9d Hayes said, \xe2\x80\x9cand it\xe2\x80\x99s one of the most rewarding parts of this job.\xe2\x80\x9d Learn more about Tim and his conservation work by clicking the link in our  bio.
.
.
.
#renewableenergy #conservation #windpower #windturbine #renewables #biologist #wildlife #wildlifebiologist'

b'Tune in later this week as wildlife biologist Tim Hayes, takes over our Instagram account to share a behind-the-scenes look at his work in the field.
.
.
.
#renewableenergy #wildlifebiologist #biologist'

b'Located in Colorado, our Kit Carson wind facility generates enough electricity to power approximately 15,000 homes. The 34-turbine site began commercial operation in 2010.
.
.
.
#windpower #renewableenergy #windturbine #windfarm #turbine #renewables'
